result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob S. Schneidewent was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct "due to boisterous and unreasonably loud conduct only", a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Eligible to apply for expungement after one year.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Disorderly Conduct "due to boisterous and unreasonably loud conduct only"
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
10:30 am - Defendant Jacob S. Schneidewent appeared with attorney Kevin G. Klein.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. DA moves to amend charge to 947.01 Disorderly Conduct due to boisterous or otherwise disorderly conduct. Exam by Court. Response by parties.  Court orders charge amended.  DE pleads NO CONTEST to amended charge. Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.  Comments by parties.  Comments and ruling by Court. Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:42 am. 

Court imposes:
$300 fine; $200 DNAAS and submit sample; Eligible to apply for expungement after one year. 30 days to pay or CO.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob S. Schneidewent
Current: N9429 Deer Lake Ln, Phillips, WI 54555 United States  (Effective: 01-12-2016)
Prior: N7987 State Highway 13, Phillips, WI 54555

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

Defendant Jacob S. Schneidewent appeared with attorney Kevin G. Klein.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
State's Demand for Discovery & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence
